content.text: Write \(\frac{2}{5}\) as a percentage
Write these numbers in order, starting with the smallest
“We eat more ice cream as the temperature rises.”
What type of correlation is this?
The probability that it rains tomorrow is 0.35
Work out the probability that it does not rain tomorrow
Write 0.000 0523 in standard form
Write 6.8167 correct to 3 significant figures
The regular pentagon has ..................................... lines of symmetry
The diagram shows a regular pentagon and a kite
Complete the following statements
Divide 120 in the ratio \(1:2\)
Calculate \(\sqrt[3]{-4.3 \times 6.7^2}\) and write down all the figures shown on your calculator
Write your answer to part (a) correct to 4 decimal places
Insert one pair of brackets in each of the following to make the statements correct
Find an estimate for the area of the shape drawn on this \(1 \mathrm{cm}^2\) grid
Find the value of \(\left(\sqrt{25}\right)^2\)
Simplify \(\left(x^{5}\right)^{2}\)
Find the lowest common multiple (LCM) of 28 and 35
Factorise completely
The length, \(l\) metres, of a garden is 78.5 metres, correct to the nearest half metre
Complete this statement about the value of \(l\)
Neelum hires a machine to clean carpets
It costs \$25 to hire the machine for the first day and \$9 for each extra day after the first day
Neelum pays a total of \$88 to hire the machine
Work out the total number of days she hires the machine for
Dev makes 600 cakes
18% of the 600 cakes go to a hotel and \(\frac{2}{3}\) of the 600 cakes go to a supermarket
Calculate how many cakes he has left
Tomas borrows \$5000 for 3 years at a rate of \(2.5\%\) per year compound interest
He pays back the whole amount, with interest, at the end of 3 years
Calculate the total amount of money he pays back at the end of the 3 years
Without using your calculator, work out \(\frac{7}{8} +\frac{1}{6}\)
You must show all your working and give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form
On your diagram, draw a chord
Show that the circumference of the circle is \(21.99 \text{cm}\), correct to 2 decimal places
Complete the statements
21 (a) In the space below, draw a circle with diameter \(7\mathrm{cm}\)
On the internet, Pranay sees a grey jacket for 165 euros (€) and a blue jacket for \$180
These are the exchange rates
Work out which jacket is the cheapest and by how many rupees
The .........jacket is cheapest by .........rupees
Calculate \(AC\)
Calculate the size of angle \(BAC\)
Construct the perpendicular bisector of \(PQ\)
Construct the bisector of angle \(ABC\)
In this question, **use a straight edge and compasses only** and show all your construction arcs
